title: perfect?
description: Write a function `perfect?` that takes a binary search tree and returns true if the tree is perfect (all levels are completely filled), and false otherwise.

examples.explanation: An empty tree is considered perfect
A single node tree is perfect
Tree is not perfect because the leaf nodes are not at the same level

starterCode:
(define-struct node (left right key))

(define (perfect? t))

(perfect? empty)
(perfect? (make-node empty empty 5))
(perfect? (make-node (make-node empty empty 2) (make-node empty empty 8) 5))
hiddenCases: (check-expect (perfect? (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 1) (make-node empty empty 3) 2) (make-node (make-node empty empty 6) (make-node empty empty 8) 7) 5)) true)
